context_bundle.summary: Sealed Secrets is a Kubernetes controller and tool for one-way encrypted Secrets that can be safely stored in Git

onboarding.quick_start: kubectl apply -f https://github.com/bitnami-labs/sealed-secrets/releases/download/v0.19.5/controller.yaml && kubectl create secret generic my-secret --dry-run=client -o yaml | kubeseal --format yaml > sealed-secret.yaml
common_patterns: Controller installation: 'helm install sealed-secrets sealed-secrets/sealed-secrets --namespace kube-system'
Secret sealing: 'kubectl create secret generic api-key --from-literal=key=secret --dry-run=client -o yaml | kubeseal > sealed-key.yaml'
Custom namespace: 'kubeseal --namespace my-namespace --scope namespace-wide' for namespace-specific keys
Secret rotation: 'kubeseal --controller-name=sealed-secrets --controller-namespace=secrets' to target specific controller
Template usage: 'kubectl create secret generic from-template --from-env-file=.env.template --dry-run=client -o yaml | kubeseal'
Cluster-wide secrets: 'kubeseal --scope cluster-wide' for cluster-scoped secrets
known_errors: Controller not responding: 'kubectl get pods -n kube-system -l name=sealed-secrets-controller' and check pod status
Sealing failed: 'kubeseal --fetch-cert --namespace sealed-secrets > pubcert.pem' to verify controller certificate
Secret not unsealing: 'kubectl logs -n kube-system sealed-secrets-controller' and check for decryption errors
Version mismatch: 'kubeseal --version' and ensure kubeseal and controller versions match
Namespace error: 'kubectl get sealedsecret -n my-namespace' and verify correct namespace targeting
